title: bad service now on hold again
body: on phone two hours got from 24 to 2 then cut off this has happened before now on hold again 14  service  a shambles sorry cant plan when unwell

title: Very “one size fits all”
body: Would like to echo a previous review I just read about this service not being suitable for anyone who is on the autistic spectrum or neurodivergent. I’m sure they help lots of people but I encountered a very one size fits all approach that I found very frustrating and completely unsuitable for my own needs. I of course can’t speak for others and it is genuinely warming to see so many positive reviews here but if you have complex mental health needs, I would advise you to proceed with extreme caution at cgl Manchester. There used to be a thing here called the dual diagnosis service for such complex cases and sadly this no longer exists due to funding cuts which is a shame. Cgl are picking up the slack from that and whilst I don’t think it’s their fault as an organisation, my views remain strong; that cgl is largely unsuitable for anyone with complex mental health needs, prolonged mental illness and anyone of a neurodivergent disposition

readBy.name: Change Grow Live
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: futile survey
body:
just been invited on phone to rate my experience yesterday on five point scale between very good and very poor. I just can't believe that aggregating rubbish like this creates anything meaningful in the sense of improving the service. It may create jobs, make someone feel satisfied or whatever, but improving a service must need something more textured, nuanced, qualitative
In my case, two downside things related to wait, upside of good treatment and one don't know.
1: wait for 90 min royal hallamshire minor injuries,assessed and taxied to main a&e about 1 hour, where started nearly 4 hour wait for triage so 6-7 hours total before wound closure started- not too bad but becoming less than ideal, emotion says some weight could be given to hallamshire wait rather than starting clock again at northern general as for me its the total experience that matters
2: no obvious ideal fluid in a&e waiting room, had lost good couple of units blood, feeling shocky, would have been nice to have access to milk, orange juice or similar for fluid replacement and comfort. Machine with coke etc not working so left with coffee and water from toilet sink tap - undignified
3: wound sorted and stitched by really confidence inspiring nurse who manged to be both professional and friendly at (& over) end of shift when she must have been tiring
4: not sure - I was never really asked about how much blood lost, still pretty woozy and breathless today so expect quite a bit, I know value of doing blood count is debatable, so not sure if not considering this was right or corner cutting

My point is, rating this as 3/5 or 4/5 or 5/5 really does nothing at all to address any of the issues raised in qualitative response

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield
Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: New Website
body: The new web pages has Clinic + Services area, I selected the Carer Form and in the Select Surgery area the choice is Kings Norton Surgery or Ash Tree Surgery. This is useless for me to Reister as a Carer for my husband. We are both patients of the Avon Valley Practice, Upavon Wiltshire. This site is not 'Hard of Hearing' friendly, there is no way now to write online to ask for an appointment, not everyone can use a telephone. Text or email is better for the Hard of Hearing.

author: echotp58
title: Reassuring service
body: I had anaemia and swollen logs were causing me distress. I was unable to be admitted to hospital due to it being full. I was then referred to hospital at home. Wonderful staff and a reassuring service.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

author: Sharon1234
title: Poor communications and diagnosis
body:
After being given quite an upsetting diagnosis with a heart condition over the phone, it took over 6 weeks for a letter to be sent to my GP to confirm I needed to take a very common medication to help manage this.  
This was only after numerous calls to the secretarial staff, the majority of whom were very lovely, but one told me they had two secretaries for 9 consultants and that I would have to wait! I raised two complaints with PALS, the second one they haven’t even bothered to acknowledge. More worryingly, clues to my recent diagnosis were completely disregarded/ ignored at the A&E at this hospital in January this year. The cardiologist I spoke to basically confirmed this.  
Reading NICE guidelines, based on my symptoms, chances to identify my condition were missed completely and it’s only through my own doggedness and awareness through self research that I have now got some answers and basically pushed for tests and confirmed my own diagnosis with a rare condition. I feel that although the staff are lovely, this hospital is currently not fit for purpose, and poses quite a danger to its patients. I do not think it is a good time to be ill in Preston.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good service
body:
I find the staff at the Booking Office at Preston very helpful. They are caring, obliging and very knowledgeable, I have spoken to 3 different members of staff today and they are all so caring and helpful.
I want you to know I am extremely grateful for all you do and all you have already done.

author: arapw36
title: Support from the Neurological Rehabilitation Centre
body:
My wife was diagnosed with Multiple Systems Atrophy (MSA) during August 2020 and was referred to the CNCMT in December 2020.  
We are very grateful for the help and support that the CNCMT has provided to my wife to make her life more comfortable and help me as her main carer. All of them were very helpful and caring towards my wife plus they provided her with very useful and professional advice and help.  
Nicolette has provided my wife with very useful advice and equipment, which would have been impossible to look after her without them.  
Lana made the arrangements for my wife to be provided with a PEG since she could not swallow her food and medication plus advised her with her diet.  
Lauren advised our physiotherapist on the type of exercises to use for my wife’s condition.  
Emma has provided very useful information to help with my wife’s communication since her voice is becoming very soft. Also, together with Lana, she helped my wife with the type of food to avoid to minimise the risk of choking.  
Thank you to all the team for their professional and caring support to my wife.

readBy.name: Royal Free Neurological Rehabilitation Centre

title: Extremely helpful
body: Had a dog bite at work, rang surgery late in a Friday. Helpful receptionist and extremely nice nurse who slotted me in, dressed wound, tetanus jabbed and consulted doctor who gave covering antibiotics. Very efficient and reassuring. Thanks to all involved!

title: Great Doctor!
body: The Doctors are great and have helped me immensely and still are, so for that I would like to thank them.

title: Great service
body: Staff are very helpful, and when you can't get a normal GP appointment and don't need A&E this is an invaluable service. I've always had a good experience, even when I've had to wait a few hours.

title: Excellent service
body: Twice recently I have emailed to ask for things to be done and both times the response has been within the hour and my problems solved. Thank you so much

title: Great doctors
body: I recently had a consultation with one of the lead GPs. She was the tall, lady dr and she is caring. I have to say, she is one of the best doctors. She is caring and understands and eager to help patients. I have always had the best experience with her. Thank you Dr for your kind and thoughtful concern to my health and providing me with both medical and physical care. Keep it up !

title: Student and Nurse Brilliant
body: I had to go to audiology today , my appointment was made within a few weeks , they were always on time , spent as kind as I needed , no rush , I really felt looked after and I can now hear again

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Service cannot be faulted !
body:
Having had at least 6 Hand Operations at Orpington Hospital I can give it nothing but praise dd!  Staff are kind and considerate, and nothing is too much trouble !
In fact I am treated like part of the family 
Tonight I have had Roast Chicken for Dinner, 
which was excellent !

title: Reliable, prompt and friendly
body: Even though it’s a really busy practice you can get an appointment when you need it and the doctors and reception staff are really helpful. They offer you either telephone or face to face which is great. You can feel how busy and stretched they are but they are always polite and practical so I find it all really efficient. My old surgery was painful to deal with so this is a welcome change for our family. Thanks to the Parkside team

title: Great practice
body: A lot easier to booked appointments, I can see the doctor If my choice. The staff are always helpful and polite and always try the best to help with my requests.

title: Quick and efficient appointment process
body:
Submitted a request using the online system after lunch on a Friday and I had a reply within 2 hours telling me and apointment had been booked for an out of hours doctor the following day. Very efficient and makes it easier knowing I don’t have to wait on the phone and is more convenient. 
Also got straight through on the phone to book nasal flu for so and got an appointment within a few days . Would highly recconmend and have never had any issues.

title: Excellent care at Barnet Hospital
body: Every member of staff, from porters to consultants, were wonderful and caring. I can’t fault the medical care I received during my stay

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient,proffessional and supportive
body:
The crew who came to attend our call was extremly supportive not to mention proffesional and super caring to my child who has autism
They made us feel safe and was cared for
Thank you very much
Your help is very much appreciated and we are greatful

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Exemplary practice
body:
I attended the casualty department without an appointment. The attention I received from registering until being seem by a doctor was courteous, sensitive and thorough. 
Thank you to the team. I cannot fault the service I received and am deeply grateful. It was very busy during the morning but this in no way affected the patient xare afforded to all present.
I experienced the NHS at its best this morning.

readBy.name: Royal Berkshire NHS Foundation Trust

title: A GP surgery that actually cares. Thank you all
body: Just wanted to write a few words of appreciation. Excellent team at Triangle. My mum has been well looked after over here, I have recently moved my mum to this practice from another one down the road, and must say Triangle has been great so far. Recommend to all my friends and family. I always get her appointments and vaccines on time. Recently has had several catch-up calls about her medication review and blood pressure follow-up too. Great work guys.

author: Barney Rubble
title: To all the staff at Stracathro I pass on my heartfelt thanks
body:
I was diagnosed with bilateral Inguinal hernias in September 2019 but due to the pandemic and associated pressures it was not until October 2022 that I entered Stracathro Hospital for corrective surgery. By this time the hernias had definitely worsened and were causing severe discomfort.  
The staff at Stracathro could not have been more attentive, considerate and professional. I entered as a Day surgical case with the intention of being allowed home the same day upon certain conditions. During my stay all details were explained to me by the Surgeon, the Anesthetist, Nurses and all those associated with my care. Indeed I felt the care I received went above and beyond, nurses in particular going the extra mile to help me once the surgery had been completed. I did not know much about the surgery at the time as, of course, I was under a general anesthetic. Post surgey was not straightforward and there were some medical complications that could not have been dealt with better or more timeously. I got home on the evening of having fulfilled the conditions for release and I have to say that, despite no one wishing to go into Hospital, if I have to at a time in the future I would happily go back to Stracathro and place myself in the care of this dedicated group of staff at this NHS facility.  
I cannot thank them enough. I am now a couple days past my surgical procedure and despite being sore and very tender I am mobile and moving around with an added element of care. I am no youngster any more, at the time of writing I am 70 years of age and I believe my recovery so far has been successful due to the care received during my stay. I am now looking forward to a long and healthy future and to once again undertake climbs of the Munros which had become a late in life addiction for me and one that gives me so much satisfaction.  
To all the staff at Stracathro I pass on my heartfelt thanks for the way you took me into your care, looked after me during and post the procedure and released me again to my very happy wife at the end of a difficult day.

readBy.name: NHS Tayside

title: Super professional service
body:
My daughter had been unwell over last few weeks. 
All doctors have been extremely helpful in assessing and managing her symptoms.
Can’t fault the team at CHC.
Thank you everyone

title: Great Practice
body: The surgery has always been very prompt and efficient in servicing my repeat prescriptions and ensuring that the necessary scans and flu  vaccinations have been done. I am very grateful for the smooth operation they run.

author: Colville1
title: Care in cardiology day unit.
body: I would like to give all staff I came in contact with the highest praise and thanks.  Everyone I dealt with treated me with kindness and respect. The team are very efficient, knowledgeable and reassuring.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran

title: Caring Practice
body:
I have ongoing problems, difficult to tie down, but the doctors are really patient and thorough in trying to find the cause. They are very friendly and easy to talk with, and actually listen to what I say.
In common with most practices, it can take time to get through on the phone, but there are many on-line ways to get through and the actual treatment is great. Certainly one of the best local surgeries.

title: Thank you
body:
Hi a big thankyou to all the Docs and Nurses on Montuschi ward who were very frendly ,Sorry that I discharged myself but my medical phobia got the better of me after 5 day's ,a real pain .but I did take your advice onboard. Hope I'll be ok as an outpatient .
   Thank you for putting up with me

title: Excellent service
body: Really pleased with service provided by GP in relation to chronic condition I was subsequently diagnosed with. I felt the GP was thorough, took me seriously and explained everything fully along the way. Thank you!

title: Good experience
body: Staff made me feel calm and explained every part of the process including after care. Even walked you out of the treatment area ensuring all your concerns were addressed.

title: Best practice
body:
I attended Leatside Surgery last Thursday  and I just wanted to say how lovely the reception team, nurses and doctors are. Everyone at the front desk is friendly and polite, nurses and doctors never make you feel rushed. The doctor I saw was very thorough and professional with a really pleasant and caring manner. 
A great big thank you to all of you. 
Kind regards 

Outlook for Android

author: Devsb78
title: Poor experience in the Dialysis Unit
body:
I was transferred to Wonford Acute Unit from Southmead Renal Unit after my kidneys failed. I had spent a lifetime seeing Southmead and never wanted the transfer. I only wish I had not. My experience was one of absolute disbelief, staff that no longer acknowledged me when arriving for dialysis after I confronted the nurse in charge for accusing me of lying about a condition brought by a serious motorbike accident many years prior.  
I felt alienated and that I was being lied to. Staff appeared to barely acknowedge me. It got that bad that I stopped attending my dialysis. I was transferred to Barnstaple. I arrived there and they had not even transferred my care, they knew nothing about me. My line is not working correct. My bloods are not good. Again, it seems, I was another patient who suffered the poor care and stigma of the staff.  
I had a doctor make me feel like I was nothing - they indicated that they did do not see the issue with my kidneys as they had seen ones that were a lot bigger. Then they had the absolute nerve to call me "hun" after making me feel like I should not be there.  
I have been left with the most horrid memories of a time that I would never repeat. I have cancelled the appointments made and I am due to return for a right nephrectomy next month. I would much rather take my chances. I have never felt so low, so belittled, completely in disbelief that the nurses attitude towards me was so poor come the end.  
I do not believe the department had checked the machine used for the fistula check from the day I had it fitted, or had followed the correct protocol, knowing I was being discharged elsewhere. This experience has left me absolutely in fear of even opening up.  
I left AMU on one occasion after hearing staff members laughing at a dementia patient. Being left for many hours without pain relief and feeling snapped at by a nurse and asked what I wanted them to do about it. Having to request that the staff wear their PPE when they approached me. Night staff where laughing, shouting and messing about until a male individual really shouted at them at 01:00. I am in utter turmoil by my experience and one that has left my health very very poor and they are supposed to be the best of the best.

readBy.name: Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021
Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Great practice.
body: Absolutely fantastic support. Highly recommended. Have multiple patients registered here and it is a fantastic service when in need.

title: Thank you
body:
Hi a big thankyou to all the Docs and Nurses on Montuschi ward who were very frendly ,Sorry that I discharged myself but my medical phobia got the better of me after 5 day's ,a real pain .but I did take your advice onboard. Hope I'll be ok as an outpatient .
   Thank you for putting up with me

title: Thank you
body:
Hi a big thankyou to all the Docs and Nurses on Montuschi ward who were very frendly ,Sorry that I discharged myself but my medical phobia got the better of me after 5 day's ,a real pain .but I did take your advice onboard. Hope I'll be ok as an outpatient .
   Thank you for putting up with me

title: Amazing Practice
body: I woukd like to thank my GP at this practice and his secretaries for all their support during my 5 months back ordeal. After a successful spinal decompression I am able to walk, work and enjoy life again ! Thank you NHS

title: Well looked after
body:
A&E looked extremely busy and so full yet all the staff had time and a smile for you.  I was very well looked after and my back injury was totally cared for. 
Thank you.

title: Blood taking department
body:
I attended the blood taking department on the 1st November morning . The staff were friendly and couldn’t do enough for me. The blood taking was the best I have had and I wasn’t sore afterwards. Would recommend going here for bloods. 
Thank you to all staff.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I’m very content and happy on this ward
body: I have been in Craigavon hospital for two weeks, I came in to receive an elective operation, thankfully everything went well and I am now on the orthopedic ward recovering. Everything has been really good on the ward my room is very big and the facilities are all really clean, the bed is a bit narrow that’s all. The food on the ward is lovely, especially for the number of patients that need catered for, there so busy and it’s still great. The care I have been receiving is just amazing, the nurses are just so caring and kind they always make sure to tuck me into bed at night, I’m very content and happy on this ward. When I ring the buzzer for the nurses, they always come to me on time I’m never left waiting. The only things I can think of that need to be improved is that there is no remote for the TV and I think this is very important, as it’s hard to pass time. The signal and Wi-Fi in my room is also very poor, which is very annoying, if this could be improved it would great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Verydissatisfied
title: Minor Injuries Unit
body:
I was sat at home and had a sudden onset of palpitations which weren't stopping. After 20 mins I had tingling round my lips and fingers.  
We went down to Peterhead Minor Injuries Unit, rang the buzzer and the nurse said they were only a nurse and I would have to call 111. By this point I felt lightheaded and sick.  
My partner called 111. It took 45 mins to get through. I spoke to a clinician who couldn't understand why they had made me call 111 when I had presented they way I did. They said to stay and they would put through a note for me to be seen.  
It seems ridiculous making people call 111 from the hospital when they should have just seen me.

readBy.name: NHS 24
NHS Grampian

title: Excellent clinical care
body:
I was in the Hospital for 4 weeks,including time in Intensive Care and latterly on Ward 17.The resources used in identifying my illness,investigating it and treating it were extensive and impressive.Thank goodness for,and thankyou to the NHS.
    Once I was well enough,it was important to me to know what was going on,to get any prognosis available and to understand the next steps.Under comparatively light interrogation from me,the Doctors and Consultants were open with their responses.Some even had a sense of humour(also important to me in keeping sane).
    Finally, I am well aware that the Gastro team were supported by many other teams both in the Hospital and with the continuing treatment after being discharged.The kindness of members of these teams was a  key element on the road to making a full recovery.

author: INFJ23
title: A&E / CAU at crosshouse hospital
body:
I was in A&E a few months ago with a clot in my lung. I have autism and I am trans so being in the hospital was very difficult. I had to re-visit due to shortness of breath again and I was so scared and worried.  
I had the same doctor as the first time which was such a relief as she remembered me. Dr Shepard is a lovely doctor and I genuinely felt at ease in her care. She took a genuine interest in relation to me being trans and the hrt impacting on my health but did not force me to make any decisions which was an extremely pleasant surprise. There's something a lot of other doctors can learn from Dr S.  
I also had another lovely lady who remembered me from my VQ scan months ago. (sorry didn't get her name if she was doc or senior nurse or something) She apologised to me for not realising I was trans and if she had previously used wrong pronouns. Wow, I could have cried from happiness, small things like these mean so much to trans people especially in these trying times.  
I hope all my future experiences are as pleasant as this time. These two ladies are exactly the doctors I hope other Dr's and nurses aspire to be like. I will continue to spread my positive experience as its the least I can do.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran

author: statusqm38
title: Ongoing back, hip and leg pain.
body:
I have been unable to work because of severe pain in my lower back, hips and both legs. I was referred to physio at Wishaw General and after 2 sessions, only 1 of which I was physically examined on, I was told there was nothing they could do for me.  
My GP then made an urgent referral to orthopaedics, but after waiting a week I decided to phone, as the pain is so bad it is affecting my sleep and restricting my every movements. I was told that even though I hadn't been to any orthopaedics appointment or physically examined, that I had been taken off the urgent list.  
I went back to my GP who again gave me a combination of tablets to take but, as with all the others I have taken this year, they've had little or no effect. My GP stated that they could do nothing else if orthopaedics decided my condition isn't urgent. This has really felt like the last straw and I have never felt as low in my life.  
My employer is now putting pressure on me to get things done or risk losing my job, which. As you can imagine, this has only made my mental health state far worse. I have paid for private Bowen therapy and and paid for a muscle injury clinic to try to help my pain but as of yet, sadly, to no avail.  
I don't know what else to do as I can't go on living every single minute of every single day of my life in severe pain. Please can someone help?

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire
North Lanarkshire Advocacy

author: Clyde22
title: Staff at ambulatory care
body: My mum was referred down to university hospital wishaw one evening recently, with suspected Stoke. We arrived in the early evening. From when we arrived the staff were great with her. She got bloods tested and ct scan and confirmed it wasn't a stroke. The staff at the ambulatory care was fantastic with her. They took their time with her and made sure I was with her and was made aware of what was happening. Special thanks to Cara and her colleagues who were on that night. I believe the Doctors surgery's are sitting empty and the staff in this department are run off their feet. It's absolutely shocking. 8 hours we waited. The staff should get a massive wage rise as they go above and beyond. Thanks again staff at the ambulatory care in wishaw

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire

title: Wonderful hospital and staff
body: I was referred by my local doctor for a Focussed Ultrasound Thalamotomy to correct my severe hand tremor. As I live 100 miles away I didn't think that I had much chance of getting seen but I got an appointment within 3 months and from my first assessment until my operation took only 3 months! I cannot praise highly enough the Walton Centre facility and the amazing Consultant, Doctors, Nurses, Radiologists, Physio, Occupational therapists, ancilliary staff, secretaries and receptionists, who made sure that I got the very best treatment. Nothing was too much trouble, if I rang up with queries or worries they were answered in a sympathetic manner. The operation was very successful and has changed my life by giving me back control in one hand. This means that I can now eat, drink and write unaided and have had my confidence restored to enable me to go out socially again. Communication by letter and phone calls is excellent and aftercare very thorough. All the staff I came across were friendly, caring, professional, supportive and accommodating. I feel so privileged to have been given this operation and I will  be eternally grateful to everyone at the Walton Centre Neurology Department for all they have done for me.

readBy.name: The Walton Centre NHS Foundation Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The theatre team were great
body: I have been on the ward for a week after I came in to receive an operation, the theatre team were great, and everything went as planned I was very nervous before but the staff on the ward helped keep me calm and were there for me. I have had no issues on the ward I have been receiving the best care, the ward is great, it’s the perfect size and its always spotless I have my own bathroom in my room, so this is good as I have it to myself.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: bluekc96
title: My girlfriend's experience
body:
Over the last few days my girlfriend who is 21 weeks pregnant and 16 years old was having an unusual amount of panic attacks. She suffers from anxiety and decided to phone her midwife, who didn’t answer and then triage who said to call the GP, They told us to head to the hospital to have her heart checked without seeing her first  
After a very long wait in the waiting room she was put in a ward where they checked her heart with heart monitors and had her hooked up to all kinds of machines. We waited a few more hours to be told she need a chest X-ray to check for a chest infection which came back negative and we were told we could leave when the doctor comes back.  
The doctor returned and said that she has to stay the night to be monitored for a blood clot and took her bloods, inserted an IV and injected her with a substance that was not explained or described to her and asked us to wait once again. After a further hour and a half of waiting she was hooked her up to a drip. When the drip finished we waited again and she was moved to a different ward where I was initially told I’d be able to stay with her overnight but was then told I couldn’t because she would be in a ward with other women. I was told to go home and leave her in a ward that in fact didn’t have any other woman - there was only one older lady and a few fully grown men who were dressed down in boxers.  
After a long sleepless lonely night that consisted of many tests being done and many drugs put in her when she had no clue what they were and when she did manage to drift off for a hour and a half she was woken up to be injected with more unknown liquids and more tests. She was then told that she had to go for a CT scan and nobody can visit until after 1 o’clock.  
After her scan they said that there will be a 1 hour max wait for the results and if all was well and the results were clear she would get to go home, when in fact we waited for over 7 hours just for the test to come back clear. and then had to wait another hour for a prescription for a urine infection, before finally being able to go home.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
NHS Lanarkshire
North Lanarkshire Advocacy

title: You can never get an appointment
body: I have been with this practise for a couple of years and each year they are getting worse. It is now impossible to schedule an appointment, as you could be waiting in the queue for hours while being the first caller in line but they will never pick up. While waiting you can hear an audio message to schedule an appointment via the e-consult, that never seems to be having availability...The only way I can book an appt for my kids is via 111. Today, I was waiting for 1 and 40 my mind (being caller number 1 for the last hour) and then I hang up. I will change and move my family to a better practise.

title: Undecided
body: I generally love this surgery, receptionists are always extremely helpful. However, the past 2 visits I have been left feeling like an inconvenience and upset and not being listened to. Both doctors talked over me trying to explain my history and symptoms, both doctors didn’t seem to have an understanding of my history or want to take on board the fact that I may know myself and my condition. Previously I’ve had exceptional service from doctors at this surgery so it was actually very damaging to my self confidence (I have to build myself up to leave the house let alone explain sensitive issues) and this has resulted in increased anxiety which will no doubt turn into the need for further appointments. I don’t want to change surgery but I feel like some of the doctors need a greater awareness of invisible conditions and the importance of not leaving the patient feeling belittled and frustrated by the lack of support. E.g. telling a patient that they “just have to get over it” or that they should “wait for therapy before doing anything”…waiting lists for therapy are approximately 24 months, when a patient is gradually getting worse and cannot leave home alone then there should at minimum be an exploration of treatments for the ongoing condition. I left the appointment feeling like I’d been spoken to like someone who didn’t understand anything when I actually have a deep understanding of my situation from a private and personal level. I hope things change back to the previous levels of service.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The food isn't nice at all
body: I came in this morning at 10am. I have been coming to the Mandeville now for about 2-3 years. My nurse today was Melissa, she is amazing. All of the nurses are fabulous. I didn’t have any food today as I felt a bit sick, however the food in general isn’t nice at all. The unit is always kept very clean. The only thing I would say is that, I would appreciate if the TV was working as when you don’t have family and friends in with you it can be very boring.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Face face appointment
body: Had telephone appointment with a doctor that I have never seen so it felt very impersonal. Need to get back to one to one appointments

title: Very bad website
body:
Just want to download a form to record blood pressure readings.
No sign of a form like that on the website.
Perhaps a section for 'downloadable forms' would be a good idea ?

Do I feel a valued as a user of the web site ?

No, it is not at all engaging, nor very informative.

title: If you can get an appointment they're good
body:
Once I've got an appointment it's a relatively painless process whenever I've had anything to do with them... Only issue is 90% of the time ringing for an appointment you get told to fill out an online form, and when you fill out the form (which is only open 3 hours a day) half the time you're told 'sorry no appointments try again tomorrow' at around 5pm. The amount of times I've ended up at the hospital because I can't get an appointment, or when they do give me one it's not for another 2 weeks (by which point the problem has either fixed itself or I've ended up at a&e)
I can't fault the staff, but the process and waiting time is absolutely ridiculous

title: Great service
body: Invited for a flu jab Saturday 8.30 in and out within 5 minutes extremely efficient service. In all the years  I have been registered at this practice , always received first class treatment

title: Virtually impossible to book an appointment
body:
I am a new patient. I called today to book an appointment which is relatively urgent. I was told to use the online system and to wait till 7 pm when the appointments for the next day come up. I was on time, but the few appointments that came up at 7 pm disappeared within less than 15 seconds.
Booking a doctor's appointment shouldn't feel like trying to win the lottery. I have wasted a day - had I known that booking was so difficult, I would have gone straight to a walk-in centre. I see that someone else has flagged this in another review, which concerns me that this experience is not unique and that it could keep happening. If this is due to a glitch in the system, I strongly encourage the practice to fix it asap; however if it is not a glitch, they should consider to stop accepting new patients, because they cannot provide a good enough service with the current numbers.

title: Flu Vaccination
body: Quick, well delivered and organised vaccination at an ideal location.  Need to sort out the confusing location in the text messages next time though.

title: Poor decision regarding parking charges
body: Could I ask why parking charges were reintroduced and don't management believe this is to the detriment of patients and family who are having to rely on the Royal Marsden for life critical care. Do you not think cancer patients are already facing substantial loss and barriers given the nature of their illness. I would welcome a chat to someone who thinks this is okay. Regards Ian

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Extremely long waiting time
body:
We had to wait 2 hours to see someone which is totally unacceptable. Appointment times should be given. It is disrespectful of the patient's time.
.

title: Unhappy Experience
body: I am very sorry to say that I visited the A&E on a Saturday with my daughter who was in pain and we had no other option but to visit. We didn't want to but she needed a medical opinion and to be honest it was a nightmare. We had to wait for 6 hours, being triaged x 2 by very unfriendly, unhappy nurses who were so under pressure who asked if my daughter should be there!  It was packed with so many people with mental health issues, mum and children, people with broken legs, arms, burns and bites.  Old people crying and sitting in bewilderment. It was like a living nightmare for me and I wasn't ill. Something needs to change. Instead of people flocking to a big hospital perhaps the GP surgeries should be open 24/7 especially at the weekends with access to scanning equipment, etc or the community hospitals need to be reopened. Too many people are coming to A&E because there is no where else to go.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Marhj36
title: Poor care by your triage nurse
body:
I went in with a bad open cut after banging my head in the garage I work at. Being on blood thinners I thought I should go to A&E and get the wound closed up.  
The lady on reception booked me in fine then I went in to see the triage nurse who didn’t even look at the wound. When I asked them to they said that’s not a priority which I found strange as they couldn’t see it - it was in my hairline. They said nothing about scanning my head.  
After a total of 10 hours waiting after two separate visits and feeling unwell I left with a 4 inch open cut which wasn’t even looked at. Some staff on reception were so nice but one I found very rude.  
That is the last time I will go to hospital unless I’m on a stretcher. I know they are busy but to force me home after me feeling unwell with a bad headache and sickness seems wrong and I feel it should be looked into.  
The triage nurse said nothing to me about any scan so now I’m home with an open cut headache and on blood thinners.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everything is good
body: I was in today at 3pm and I have been coming to the unit for 5 and a half years. My nurse today is Maureen, she is so pleasant. The nurses are all wonderful. I only get food sometimes, usually just soup and bread but it is dead on. The cleanliness is all very good, I wouldn’t make any changes to the unit.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: endowarrior_
title: Poor treatment in a&e
body:
I first presented to A&E in October with severe abdominal pain for several days that wasn’t being relieved by OTC medications. In A&E I was basically told to go back to my GP, keep taking paracetamol (even though they had no affect) and that A&E weren’t there to deal with acute pain. They thought it was most likely a flare up of my endometriosis and they couldn’t refer to gynaecology, only a GP can. I had bloods done that showed my CRP levels were slightly raised..  
I presented again yesterday due to severe pain, nausea, spiking a temperature, loss of appetite and as i’m unsure whether my IUD is still in place, 111 sent me to a&e. I have never being more disgusted about the so-called treatment I received.  
Firstly I spent 4 hours in the waiting room to be triaged and sent to the Urgent Care Centre, only to be told to make an appointment with the GP as coil checks isn’t something they do. This was the second time I had been been fobbed off and I wanted to be seen by someone else. Secondly, I found the senior doctor to be one of the most arrogant and condescending I have ever come across. They agreed that my symptoms needed investigation but not via A&E as it wasn’t considered an emergency despite spiking a temperature, being in severe pain & losing my appetite as I have increased levels of nausea. When I pointed out that my CRP levels were still raising and were still elevated after 3 weeks, I was told I shouldn’t attempt to interpret the results of the CRP as only doctors can do that.  
So I have potentially a lost coil and signs of an infection but A&E don’t consider this an emergency nor will they investigate why I have an infection. I guess they’re waiting until I get seriously ill or develop sepsis.  
I refuse to go back to Stepping Hill ever again and will be avoiding this hospital in future.

readBy.name: Stockport NHS Foundation Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Food isn't hot enough
body: I was in this morning at 8.40am and I have been coming to the unit since march time. My nurse today was Mel, the nurses are so amazing and can’t do enough for you. The food is just okay, I like my food to be piping hot and the time it gets round to everyone it just isn’t hot enough for my liking. The cleaners are absolutely fabulous. I would also say that the TVs working would be a great fix for my boredom as when you’re sitting here all day you’d like to have something on.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: bungle53
title: Poor information and advice
body:
I had a cystoscopy yesterday which resulted in being given an outpatient prescription form which I was told I must get filled today (Sunday), by driving a 60 mile round trip to the nearest hospital with an outpatient pharmacy open on Sunday - the Senior Medic assured me it was.  
It does not open on Sundays. I cannot understand why they could not give me a prescription for a community pharmacy, and why their knowledge of the hospital systems was so poor.

readBy.name: Steve Baker's Office, MP for Wycombe

author: Pat51
title: In safe hands
body: My mum from the very start was treated with compassion, dignity and respect. This was all received from a friendly team who all worked well together . They all made me feel very welcome and were informative . You are in safe hands in ward 51.

readBy.name: Fife Health & Social Care Partnership
NHS Fife

author: Biker72
title: This service could potentially be a life saver
body:
I attended my doctors in mid 2022 after having some serious (to me) mental health issues that were starting to affect my marriage. I’m lucky my wife was a mental health ambassador at her work and was very supportive of me. I had started to have some serious anger issues and almost like panic attacks at the thought of going out and mixing with people. I think if it wasn’t for work I would have hardly left the house.  
I was put in touch with Sam the occupational therapist who listened to my issues and helped me find ways to deal. She suggested several different options, some of which worked for me and some didn’t. Everyone is different so it’s worth trying all options. I ended up finding some ways to help deal with the anger issues and on anti depressants which definitely helped me. With Sam's help I have started going out more and am finding it easier to mix socially. I used to be out every weekend before the covid years and that had tailed off to the point I was making excuses not to attend social events.  
I have a daughter who has her own mental health issues and I know from her that trying to get access to a mental health professional through the NHS is almost a non starter at the moment so the service provided at my local doctors surgery was a major bonus. This service only being available locally to me at the moment, when Sam asked me if I was willing to write a brief review of my experience I agreed immediately.  
This service could potentially be a life saver and in my humble opinion should definitely be supported and funded further to enable expansion to other areas.

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire
North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Scottish Recovery Network
North Lanarkshire Advocacy

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: TV is broken
body: I came in today just before 10 past 2 as my appointment was at half 2, I have been coming to the Mandeville unit now for nearly a year. My nurses today were Megan and Chloe. The staff are all exceptional. The food is very nice, when I come into the unit I usually just have a cup of tea but when I was previously in the wards I really enjoyed it. The cleanliness is amazing. I think if the Tv’s were working it would be great as, I feel as though it would be a bit of company, as I live alone I always have the TV or the radio just for a bit of background noise as the silence would drive me mad. Even when I was in the hematology ward there were no television only when the queen had died so at least that gave us something to watch for the next 2 weeks.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

author: Niamhh1
title: Good overall
body: I was in this morning at 10am and I have been coming to the unit for 12 years now, so a very long time. My nurse today was Megan, she’s looked after me very well. The nurses are outstanding. The food isn’t too bad I usually just have toast, but it’s fine. Cleanliness is all good, wouldn’t change anything.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Unprofessional nurse’s
body:
Very unprofessional and unorganised stuff 
Lost my test and they had to do the test again 
Made me wait for 10 hours just to get me into an empty bed 

I do jot recoment this hospital to anyone.

title: Lack of Mask Wearing
body: I was really disappointed to see so many staff, patients and visitors not wearing masks particularly in a hospital. I am immunosuppressed and this is really worrying. I expected people to be wearing masks in a hospital and I don’t understand why people are not wearing masks.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Helpful practice
body:
Really helpful reception staff. 
The doctors are great but it’s frequently the receptionists who manage to facilitate requests and necessary contact with clinicians.

title: Bad experience
body: Incompetent, Been waiting for 6 weeks to get and xray when my chest specialist can get me an Xray in days, Went there today and another patient there was unhappy about the service as well, I will be changing surgeries that s for sure

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Food is standard
body: I came to lurgan a few days ago. I came from Craigavon and was brought over by the ambulance. The food is very good, I don’t see much wrong with it, and it’s pretty standard, the menus have lots of variety. The nurses are always so lovely and very friendly. The ward is also always gleaming, the cleaners do a great job.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: A&E wait
body: Over six hours in A&E for my wife and myself. During this, when asked about the hospitals own policy regarding 4 hour checks, staff became short tempered and said they haven’t got time or staff. One elderly man next to us had an injured elbow with the bone visible. 3 hours he sat there, only to find out he is on blood thinners!!!! what is happening calow hospital !!!!

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent GP practice
body: I cannot praise this surgery highly enough. I've always found it easy to get an appointment when needed.  The doctors and nurses are very good with the telephone reviews and I've found that we get an appointment either the same day for urgent problems or within a week or so for less urgent problems. The staff are all very kind and empathetic. I've been with this practice for 10 years now and have since registered my children here too, the care is fantastic.

title: A&E Experience
body:
Following a medical emergency on early morning of Saturday 8th, my experience both with the care given by the ambulance Paramedics at home and then at Lister A&E was excellent.

The two A&E doctors diagnosed the problem following X-ray and blood tests, I was then discharged with antibiotics.

OK there were waits in the ambulance and for blood test results, but with the background of NHS funding & staffing problems, my experience of the care given generally was excellent.

title: Very poor
body: I have been a patient at this surgery for over 30 years and have never known their service to be as shockingly poor as it is now.  My wife and I have had a number of poor experiences with Park St over the last few months.  The latest was yesterday when I called in to request an appointment and was offered a telephone appointment in 7 days time or a face-to-face appointment in14 days time.  Both of these were with a locum and not with a permament member of staff.  These response times are just not acceptable.  The current partners need to take a long hard look at this practice and sort themselves out.  Are the GP's now all part-time?  They should be also looking at how patients are dealt with at first point of contact, whether on the telephone or in reception because it's not good.

author: waterwq38
title: Well looked after
body: I was called for a day case. I was well looked after. The staff and treatment were all good.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

author: Geordie lass 51
title: Can't fault the care I received
body: I can’t fault the care I received at the Day Surgery Centre Musgrove. From the moment I arrived I was made to feel welcome and looked after. The nurses, surgeons and anaesthetist all took the time to listen to me and reassure me. Outstanding care, please pass on my thanks to the whole team.

title: Can't fault the service received from this caring…
body:
I recently required to be checked for chest pain symptoms and was seen by a doctor the same day I rang and thorough checks done including blood tests and ECG.  I received excellent service from a very friendly and caring GP and could not have felt in better hands.  I received texts about appointments and was telephoned by the doctor the day after blood tests were done to give me the results which was very reassuring.  The doctor took the time to explain everything and recommended follow up tests to be on the safe side.  GPs and local surgeries take a lot of stick, particularly since things have changed after Covid, and I feel this is very unfair.  They are all doing their best with sparse resources and staff and I for one could not be happier with the service I receive from The Limes.  As others have said, the facility to request a call back when hanging on in a queue to make an appointment is very helpful.  The practice seem to be actively seeking out ways to improve things for patients, and the increased use of online systems and using texts to keep patients informed is very welcome.  I would comment that there do appear to be quite a few systems to keep on top of - that may overlap and confuse folk - including System Online, NHS App, NHS Covid App, SwiftqueueU and the Princess Alexandra Hospital website for booking blood tests.  It would also help if the latter two could flag up that you need a blood test paper form if you want to book for Waltham Abbey or Ongar, as they are not in the computer system.  Conversely currently the Swiftqueue email confirmations advise it is essential you take your blood form with you to St Margaret's which is incorrect. A couple of tweaks needed there to save folk getting things wrong.  
Grateful thanks to all the staff at The Limes Medical Practice.

title: Judges Close Surgery sicker than the patients
body: I Gave up waiting on the phone and went to the surgery .First response from Jcs is to fob you off . They couldn't see me on the day which is fair enough . They said they were too busy although there was just 1 person in the upper waiting room . So I asked when I could get an appointment but their policy is I cant book in advance even though I was standing there and said I can make any day . The only choices given was call back in the morning with everyone else trying to get though , or go to Crawley or call an ambulance . This is after telling them my symptoms within 3 feet of the queue for the pharmacy .  I would suggest Rydon Homes keep Jcs on their radar . This place would be more useful as a block of flats .

title: Luck of the draw!
body:
I appreciate that Covid 19 has caused a terrible overload within the NHS, and in particular unique difficulties in GP practices, which have generally become unable to maintain a comprehensive caring service, which patients generally enjoyed previously.
Notwithstanding I find it hard to accept that, apparently, the Belmont Medical Centre needs  to operate a lottery system when allocating appointments. To subscribe, a patient needs to phone  the medical centre promptly at 8.00am in the hope of getting a winning ticket, or join the queue with other participants. My experience recently was I gained position No 13 in line, which slowly reduced to No 1. I am sorry to report that I did not win: all the appointments with a doctor had gone, but offers  of speaking later the same week to a pharmacist about my medication, and the following week to a doctor engaged by Taurus, about my health concerns were made! These were accepted gratefully!
However it would be "nice" if the Belmont Medical Practice ( if it hasn't formulated and published it already) came up with a plan to fairly allocate doctor's appointments dependent on a patient's needs ( both physical, mental or both) rather than by the luck of a draw.

Surely, though, this is an unsatisfactory state of affairs, and may I suggest, relies on the patient not being "too ill" at the time, or ambulance and hospital services at a later date if their condition worsens.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Chaz71
title: All of the staff were excellent
body:
I took my son to the ED at Hairmyres Hospital following a fall which resulted in a nasty laceration to his chin. The department was incredibly busy and we did need to wait for a few hours, but all the staff were excellent, despite being run off their feet.  
We were seen by Lisa, the Chief of nursing services, and she did an excellent job of putting my son at ease. She picked up on his anxiety and talked him through everything she was doing. Although it was very busy, she took her time to do what she could to minimise scarring. We were then seen my a doctor, who made sure there were no other problems, before being discharged.

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire

title: Once again I am waiting.
body: Once again I am still waiting ! .  As other paitents of Woodside Medica Centre You try and contact the surgery. Only for the lines to be busy once again.  I agree with other comments regarding the Receptionists some are extremely rude and unapproachable.      I am due an Blood test and Also medical review as the Doctor has sent a text to my mobile.  Saying I need to be better booked in.   I have tried again this morning to do that and once again all the lines are busy! .This not my first complaint over Woodside Medical Centre . I agree this GP Surgary is awful.           The comments I keep reading is very sad .         And yet We still get ignored. There is no excuse now including blaming the poor service on COVID. I have two neurological disorders , disabilities Autism and Dyspraxia. And like others get the door slammed into my /our faces !       I like others are not happy .       How many more complaints can I write if I and others are not listened to .  Not Happy with this .

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: can't get an appointment
body: I have been trying front 10days to get an appointment no luck. I made 30 phone calls from 8am .phone  busy for 23 minutes. 31st call through  but sorry no appointment for today. suffering from knee pain.

title: Hip Replacement Surgery
body:
I had my hip replacement  surgery in September 2022. It was an outstanding experience. I met a number of professionals from administration,  nursing staff, Physiotherapists,  chemists, anaesthetist, Orthopaedic surgeons pre and post my operation. As a team they provided an excellent service.  I was given medicines to take home with appropriate advise, which helped with pain etc. 
Nursing staff at Ringmead GP Practise were very helpful with the bandages etc.  I had post op review with the Physiotherapist and the surgeon who did the operation and got the all clear after just   7 weeks. Thanks NHS and Heatherwood Hospital

readBy.name: Frimley Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Problems
body: Wanted to make an appointment to discuss urgently needed pain relief, nothing available to book until next week,nothing to signpost to alternative way of resolving this issue,not helpfull .

title: Absolutely appalling
body: This practice has gone from bad to worse. If you are lucky enough to get through on the phone after 30-40 minutes on hold, you will probably be told that there are no appointments and the only appointments they do have are for medical emergencies only!? Is that not what A&E and the 999 is for!? You cannot book an appointment in advance and have to ring everyday when they release a handful of appointments. How are you meant to manage this if you work? The only response they offer is to go to a walk in centre which are under so much pressure because GP's are not seeing patients. Or, you could queue outside the practice from 8am to see if you are luckier that way.  Again, how are you meant to manage this when you work as you can be waiting there for hours. Or, how are the elderly meant to deal with this when they are not as mobile, maybe don't drive and in the middle of winter? Shame on you Holland House.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are very good but have a lot to do
body:
Female surgical has been good. The environment has been fine, quite noisy but it is a hospital. The food is tasty especially the soup and there is always a good amount of food on the plate. The smell is not great since I am near the bathroom, but again that cannot be helped since there is no vent in the bathroom. The place needs something to brighten it up it is a bit dull.  
The staff are very good, they have a lot to do though. They try and get everyone sorted as quickly as possible.  
Female surgical staff try their best.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Female surgical staff make me happy
body:
Female surgical has been pretty standard. I just want to go home, I am sick of being in here. The ward is noisy and can be cold, I am always under the sheets trying to keep warm. The food is not the best, it is edible though.  
The staff are good to me. They sit and talk you and it is nice being able to talk to someone and get things of your chest. The level of care I am getting is good they try their best.  
Female surgical staff make me happy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff are so kind to everyone
body:
Male medical has been good so far. The people on the ward with me have been nice and they talk away. The machines here are noisy enough but they are the things that are helping us. The level of care here is outstanding, they give me the best treatment.  
The staff are very good to everyone. Watching the staff interacting with the patients really opens my eyes to see how nice they are and approachable they are. They keep me informed with everything happening.  
Male medical staff are so kind to everyone.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Thank you for a totally positive experience.
body: Last week I attended at Cobham Hospital for an endoscopy and I cannot thank the staff enough for what was a very positive appointment. I was so impressed by the cleanliness and organisation of the building, the friendliness and efficiency of the staff and their ability to deal, not just with the mechanics of the procedure, but also the nervousness that I was feeling. Everything was properly and calmly explained and there was a very real sense of being cared for. Whilst waiting, I watched several patients attending for eye surgery and they too were treated kindly and courteously. If only more of these efficient, kindly, small hospitals existed ! thank you, so much, again.

title: Great practice
body:
I recently had to contact the surgery for help with obtaining a covid vaccination after having had my first two shots in the usa. 
The practice manager I spoke to was absolutely fantastic, and explained why the NHS booking system did not work, and rather than referring me to the NHS system again, took the time to make sure I could get the vaccine at a nearby centre. 
All the staff I have dealt with at the practice have also been wonderful to deal with, and I have recommended the practice to neighbours who are registered in Devizes.

title: Lovely receptionists and great service
body:
I went this morning and saw a lovely young man . He was very informative and exceptionally helpful.
I would be happy to see him anytime.
Thank you

title: Very good practice.
body: The Doctors and Staff are very professional and helpful! Even during the pandemic, they found a way to solve my medical problems and those of my family.

title: First Rate
body:
Very hard to find a fault. All staff very polite and made the procedure go smoothly. I would highly recommend this clinic to 
anyone who has even the slightest worry as to have surgery on ones
eye.

title: Nhs at its best
body: Appointment same morning, saw the nurse practitioner, referred to local hospital and appointment by midday, receptionists, nurse practitioner, Gp all very professional and helpful, so glad I chose this practice when I moved here a year ago, thank you

title: I'm so glad I joined this GP Practice
body: I recently registered with this practice and had a first appointment.  Friendly and efficient receptionists and highly professional and thorough doctor whom I have total confidence in.

author: tucanasy57
title: Mixed experiences
body:
Injections for age related macular degeneration. Sometimes the experiences are perfect but it all depends on how gentle the technician is who performs the operation.  
One particular person did a brilliant job while under supervision but a horrendous job later - far too rushed, too careless and to my mind arrogant, which resulted in me going to bed immediately once I got home.  
Sadly this criticism is not confined to the person mentioned above.  
I’ve heard of this complaint from other patients. I’m not alone.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Lovely Doctor!
body:
I had a visit to the Urgent Care Centre at the weekend. The waiting time was less than I expected and the Doctor was exceptional, he took time to explain everything and I did not feel that he was rushing on to the next patient.
We saw the same Dr a couple of years ago when my son was poorly, he was just as thorough then so feel very lucky to have this locally.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust
